{{Wireless embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DWL-G820 |revision=A1 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=06/17/2004 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Alpha Networks |manuf_model=WAP-G08 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=bridge |fcc_id=KA22004050007-1 |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR2313A;AR2313A-001, B16912B, 0502, TAIWAN; |cpu1_cspeed=180 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Atmel |fla1_model=AT49BV322A-70TI |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=HY57V281620HCT-H |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag=yes |serial=yes,, populated,, 4-pin header,, internal |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2313A |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR2112A;AR2112A-00, CP0083.0E, 5004, HONG KONG; |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=IC+ |eth_chip2_model=IP101A |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os=VxWorks |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.35 |default_user=admin |default_pass= |oui=00:11:95 |oui_eth=00:11:95 |default_ch= }} {{SupportPage|vendor=D-Link|model=DWL-G820}} "8WAPG08..2A1" is silkscreened on the board. ==Additional external links== *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/oldwiki/hardware/dlink On the '''''OpenWrt''''' Wiki's (old) '''D-Link''' hardware table] *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=52134 On the '''OpenWrt''' Forums] ==Serial== ===Pinout=== It seems to be a standard '''Alpha''' pinout.. 
JP2
(RxD)       (3.3) (GND) (TxD)
===Info derived from=== ====Boot log==== 

ar531x rev 0x00005850 firmware startup...
SDRAM TEST...PASSED



  WAP-G02A  Boot Procedure                       V1.0
---------------------------------------------------------
  Start ..Boot.B12..Please check the ethernet cable on port 1

Atheros AR5001AP default version 3.0.0.43A


 0
auto-booting...

Attaching to TFFS... done.
Loading /fl/APIMG1...

  Please wait, loading  image ...

  image check ok!!!

/fl/  - Volume is OK
Using factory default settings.
Please check the ethernet cable on port 1!
Attaching interface lo0...done
vxWorksTftpPackageInit: init. finish & success!
wireless client starting...
====Bootloader info==== =====help===== 
[Boot]: ?

 ?                     - print this list
 @                     - boot (load and go)
 p                     - print boot params
 c                     - change boot params
 e                     - print fatal exception
 v                     - print version
 B                     - change board data
 S                     - show board data
 n netif               - print network interface device address
 $dev(0,procnum)host:/file h=# e=# b=# g=# u=usr [pw=passwd] f=#
                           tn=targetname s=script o=other
 boot device: tffs=drive,removable     file name: /tffs0/vxWorks
 Boot flags:
   0x02  - load local system symbols
   0x04  - don't autoboot
   0x08  - quick autoboot (no countdown)
   0x20  - disable login security
   0x40  - use bootp to get boot parameters
   0x80  - use tftp to get boot image
   0x100 - use proxy arp

available boot devices:Enhanced Network Devices
 ae1 tffs

Creation date: Feb 18 2004, 12:31:30
==Probable PSU(s)== The power supply included with the US distributed units looks to be a '''JENTEC''' JTA0302A. {{hasPowerSupply |brand=JENTEC |model=JTA0302A |input_v=100-120 |input_a=0.5 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=5 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |style=small, straight |manuf_country=China }} __NOTOC__
